key_title: Key to the species of Dodonaea viscosa

source.author: Duretto, M.F.
source.title: Sapindaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Duretto, M.F. (1999). Sapindaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves oblanceolate or narrowly obovate, the largest ones >7 cm long and 15 mm wide, purplish-tinted; garden escapes
Leaves various, but generally shorter and narrower than above, or if approaching those dimensions, not purple-tinted

Leaves linear, lanceolate to narrow-elliptic or rarely oblanceolate, with length-width ratio 5–15 (–30):1; apex acute, narrow acute to acuminate, obtuse or sometimes rounded or obtuse with a short abrupt point
Leaves obovate to spatulate or obtriangular to angular-obovate, with length-width ratio usually less than 6:1; apex broad-acute to obtuse, truncate or some- times obtuse or emarginate
Leaves linear to narrow-oblong, rarely oblanceolate, not tapered at apex; apex acute to obtuse, sometimes rounded with a short abrupt point, sessile or with petiole (1–) 4–7 (10) mm long
Leaves linear-lanceolate, narrowly tapered at apex and base; apex narrow-acute to acuminate, base tapering to petiole 2.0–15 (–18) mm long
Leaves (1–) 2–4 (–6) mm wide, with length-width ratio at least 7.5:1, linear to narrow oblong, rarely oblanceolate, sessile
Leaves 6–10 (–18) mm wide, with length-width ratio less than 7.5:1, usually obovate to spatulate, sometimes oblanceolate, not linear to narrow-oblong, sessile or with petiole to c. 10 mm long

Leaves obtriangular to angular-obovate, or narrow-obovate, lamina (0.8–) 1.5–2.5 (–3.8) cm long, usually with length-width ratio less than 3.5:1; apex trun-cate or obtuse, usually with a short abrupt point or sometimes irregularly 2–3-toothed, rarely emarginate
Leaves obovate to spatulate, lamina (2.3–) 3–5.5 (–9) cm long, usually with length-width ratio greater than 3.5:1; apex broad-acute to obtuse, sometimes with a short abrupt point
